topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534ce78c6368726784350100#post_534ce78c6368726784350100
Technically you can feel your organs and hear your organs rubbing against each other; our brain just ignores it.

As someone that the hard way found out that I was immune to a type of pain killer during surgery, individuals that say "you can't feel your organs" are fucking retarded.



On a side note; I have to disagree with anyone that says breaking a bone or childbirth or such is the most painful thing people can feel.  Feeling a knife slowly cut you open and the medical equipment cutting and performing surgery inside of you and then stitching you up very little can even compare with that.  If feeling surgery without pain killers is a ten then breaking a bone is a 0.5
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
